edu.ucla.sspace.dependency
Class ConjunctionTransform

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.dependency.ConjunctionTransform
All Implemented Interfaces:
DependencyTreeTransform
public class ConjunctionTransform
extends Object
implements DependencyTreeTransform

Transforms the dependency tree by adding conjunction relations between head words and a list of words joined by a conjunction. For example, consider the sentence "There are many types of mammals, such as cats, dogs, and dolphins." If "such as" is the dominate node over the list of animals, starting with "cats", and each animal node is connected to proceeding node with "conj" link, then this method will add a link from "such as" to each of the animal nodes. Essentially, this bubbles up the conjunction link so that elements in a list are directly connected to the head node.

Author:
Keith Stevens

Method Detail

transform

public DependencyTreeNode[] transform(DependencyTreeNode[] dependencyTree)
Transforms the DependencyRelation links within a series of DependencyTreeNodes. Relations may be added or removed, and entire nodes may even be removed as long as the tree remaains connected.

Specified by:
transform in interface DependencyTreeTransform
